keyPolicies.policyDescription: Would shift the balance of power towards a fairer, greener and healthier Scotland.
Reject cuts and supports investment economy, public services, and the vulnerable.
Opposes centralisation and privatization; believes in good quality public services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: CREATE MORE JOBS IN A LOW CARBON ECONOMY
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Would work to control energy bills, tackle fuel poverty, clean up the environment, and provide hundreds of thousands of new jobs in low carbon industries.
Aims for wealth to be used for the common good, through measures such as a Land Value Tax and supporting small businesses.

mentions.candidate: James Mackenzie is ready to step up and become an MSP for the region.
mentions.tacticalSituation: James Mackenzie’s answers show he would be a strong tactical choice for both Yes and No voters.

issues.brexitEurope: If elected, he will oppose the EU exiting Britain against our will.
issues.economy: Supports investment in the economy, opposes austerity and cuts.
issues.environment: Would work to clean up the environment as part of creating more jobs in a low carbon economy.
issues.governance: Supports a fairer, greener and healthier Scotland.
issues.socialWelfare: Believes in investment over austerity for protecting the vulnerable.

leaflet.personalStatement: Student, teacher, charity worker, James Mackenzie is ready to step up and become an MSP for the region.

politicalExperience.achievements: Worked in Holyrood as an MSP's Communications Officer.

images.caption: James Mackenzie’s answers show he would be a strong tactical choice for both Yes and No voters.
